sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a trapezium.
message_1: A trapezium has one base of length 5 cm, another base of length 12 cm, and two non-parallel sides of length 7 cm each. Find the perimeter of the trapezium.
message_2:
To find the perimeter of the trapezium, we need to add the lengths of all four sides.

Perimeter = length of first base + length of second base + length of first non-parallel side + length of second non-parallel side

Given:
Length of first base = 5 cm
Length of second base = 12 cm
Length of first non-parallel side = 7 cm
Length of second non-parallel side = 7 cm

Perimeter = 5 cm + 12 cm + 7 cm + 7 cm = 31 cm

The perimeter of the trapezium is 31 cm.
